723932f-a.title: Manhattan: Wall Street - Pearl Street
723932f-a.text:
54-56 Wall Street, north side, between Pearl and William Streets, as
viewed northward on Hanover Street. The clearance in the foreground is
for the new 35-storied Wall and Hanover Building which will replace the
former 3 and 8-story Brown Brothers and Co. Building that stood here.
On the left appears the east side of the block square National City
Bank and occupying the west side of this street, from Exchange Place to
Wall Street.
June 30, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
723932f-a.folder: Wall Street & Pearl Street, Manhattan, NY

723938f-a.title: Manhattan: Wall Street - Pearl Street
723938f-a.text:
u
74-76 Wall Street, at the N.S. corner of Pearl Street.
This view shows the entrance of the Seaman's Savings Bank.
About 1926.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

723944f-a.title: Manhattan: Wall Street - Pearl Street
723944f-a.text:
Aall Street, north side, west from, but not including
Pearl Street. The Bank of New York (No. 48) is shown under
construction: .djacent to same on the east is the 31 story
National City Building (No. 52). To the left of these two new
buildings are,the early Bank of Manhattan Building, the pyramidal
P:ankers Trust Company Building and the massive New York Stock
Exchange Building. In the left foreground is the quadrangular
National City Bank. At the extreme right is the 16 story building.
No. 60-62 that is occupied by H. L. Dougherty and Company.
About 1928
S. G. Cleveland
MAY BE REPRODUCED

723941f-a.title: Manhattan: Wall Street - Pearl Street
723941f-a.text:
Wall Street, south side, west from Pearl to Broad Streets, showing at
the S.W. corner of the latter point the 22-story N.Y. Stock Exchange
Building. The low 4-story structure on the opposite corner (S.E.) is
the J.P. Morgan and Co. Building.
May 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

723943f-a.title: Manhattan: Wall Street - Pearl Street
723943f-a.text:
Wall Street, at the N.i.. corner of Pearl Street. Also shown is
Pearl Street, west side, north from Wall, to and including Pine Stree s.
The view shows the Second and Third Ave., elevated structure on
Pearl Street.
About 1929.
Underwood \& Underwood.

723939f-a.title: Manhattan: Wall Street - Pearl Street
723939f-a.text:
Wall wtreet, west from Pearl Street, to Broadway, showing
an early view of Manhattan's financial center. Trinity Church
at the fertherest point dominates this locale. Intersections
observable at the left are, Hanover, William and Broad Streets.
Note the ornate Drexel Morgan Bldg. at the latter point. This
feature erected in 1872 when taken in conjunction with the ab-
sence of the National Bank of the Republic (1880) at Broadway,
dates this scene.
Betw. 1872-80
o'
Gift of Urbrock Collection
